result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:03 PM (64-06) Defendant Cody J Lenard appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Cody J Lenard. Attorney Sempf in court for the State.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Signed Information in file.
Attorney Uzowulu will acknowledge the Information in the file, waived reading plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Cody J Lenard in court, in custody via video.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Cody J Lenard.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Priors are felonies. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody J Lenard in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan for defendant. Defendant spoke with SPD - needs one week to appoint. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Cody J Lenard in court, in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant referred to SPD. State is requesting that bond remains. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
